page.title: 06Interesting Places,Combwich.
page.content: {Combwich Labs. } Hinkley Point is a nuclear power station close to the village. It is the job of people at Combwich laboratory to check that there is not a radioactive leakage from the power station.Combwich Labs sample{milk,silt {sand and seaweed.}They also put a sort of lampshade,with netting on it, out in a field for 2 months,then they bring it back for examination. {The School and School House} {Combwitch School}was built in 1857 on a hill overlooking the river the village and the countryside.It was a church school originally,built using local stone typical of the period.In 1880 it became{Otterhampton Board {School}retaining the parish name eversince.The school house was designed by a London Architect in a grander style than the School itself.
